prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with rounded corners. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with Euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector of [0.0, 0.3333, 0.0]. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Create loop 1 with the following curves: - Line 1: Start point [0.0, 0.0], end point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start point [0.75, 0.0], end point [0.75, 0.5833] - Line 3: Start point [0.75, 0.5833], end point [0.0, 0.5833] - Line 4: Start point [0.0, 0.5833], end point [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the sketch by 0.3333 units in the normal direction, and scale the sketch by 0.75 before extruding. This creates the first part with a length of 0.75, a width of 0.5833, and a height of 0.3333. Part 2 Create a new coordinate system with Euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector of [0.25, 0.0, 0.0]. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Create loop 1 with the following curves: - Line 1: Start point [0.0, 0.5833], end point [0.3333, 0.0] - Line 2: Start point [0.3333, 0.0], end point [0.5, 0.0] - Line 3: Start point [0.5, 0.0], end point [0.5, 0.5833] - Line 4: Start point [0.5, 0.5833], end point [0.0, 0.5833] Cut the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.1667 units to create a step in the part. The resulting shape will have a stepped profile with a flat top and bottom, and its dimensions will be 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. The sides will be parallel and the top and bottom faces will be perpendicular to the sides. The step will be 0.1667 units deep.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered shape, with the narrowest point at the top. The sides of the prism are parallel and meet at right angles. The prism is centered on a white background. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: (-90.0, 0.0, -90.0) * Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1) with the following loop and lines: * Loop 1: + Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.5, 0.0) + Line 2: Start Point (0.5, 0.0), End Point (0.5, 0.625) + Line 3: Start Point (0.5, 0.625), End Point (0.25, 0.625) + Line 4: Start Point (0.25, 0.625), End Point (0.25, 0.25) + Line 5: Start Point (0.25, 0.25), End Point (0.0, 0.25) + Line 6: Start Point (0.0, 0.25), End Point (0.0, 0.0) Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.625. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.75 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.625 * Operation: New Body Part 2: Cutout in the Prism Create a cutout in the prism to form a hollowed-out center. The cutout is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) * Translation Vector: (0.2501, 0.25, 0.625) Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1) with the following loop and lines: * Loop 1: + Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.2501, 0.0) + Line 2: Start Point (0.2501, 0.0), End Point (0.2501, 0.25) + Line 3: Start Point (0.2501, 0.25), End Point (0.0, 0.25) + Line 4: Start Point (0.0, 0.25), End Point (0.0, 0.0) Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.2501. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.125 * Sketch scale: 0.2501 * Operation: Cut</description>

Draw a rectangle by creating the following lines: - Line 1: Start at (0, 0), End at (0.0067, 0) - Line 2: Start at (0.0067, 0), End at (0.0067, 0.1875) - Line 3: Start at (0.0067, 0.1875), End at (0, 0.1875) - Line 4: Start at (0, 0.1875), End at (0, 0) Close the sketch. This will create a cylindrical hole in the prism.</description>
